newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft executive sees computers outsmarting humans.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft executive sees computers outsmarting humans.

text.p: Microsoft Corp.'s leading technologist said on Monday he expects computers to outsmart humans in the next 20-30 years.
Nathan Myhrvold, chief technology officer at Microsoft, told a computer industry gathering here he expected computers to surpass human intelligence by some measures within three decades.
"We're not getting smarter every year. They are," he said of computers, adding that despite the time it takes to "boot" a PC so it will operate, it is already faster than educating people.
"Humans take 20 years to boot," he said in a spirited keynote address to the Association of Computing Machine's 50th anniversary conference on the next 50 years of computing.
